title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 60.1 - Use of certain state-owned ponds and lakes
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 60.1 - Use of certain state-owned ponds and lakes

State Regulations

The overnight mooring or beaching of boats, the use of
motors (either inboard or outboard), swimming and littering are prohibited in
the following State-owned ponds and lakes. (a) Basswood Pond: located on Otsego State

Forest No. 6, Town of Burlington, Otsego County. (b) Stony Pond: located on Madison State

Forest No. 13, Town of Nelson, Madison County. (c) Erwin Pond: located on the Erwin Game

Management Area, Town of Erwin, Steuben County. (d) Dryden Lake: located in the Town of

Dryden, Tompkins County: electric motors are permitted. (e) Papish Pond: located in the Town of

Cincinnatus, Cortland County: electric motors are permitted. (f) Mallett Pond: located on Schoharie State

Forest No. 7, Town of Fulton, Schoharie County. (g) Looking Glass Pond: located on Schoharie

State Forest Nos. 4 and 6, Town of Fulton, Schoharie County. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
60.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
